script:
TITLE: IT'S A LONG WAY TO THE TOP

FADE IN:

EXT. SUBURBAN BACKYARD – DAY – 1965

A cluttered, sunlit yard. COLIN (age 3, chubby, tousled blonde hair, blue eyes, always a bit disheveled) sits in the grass, banging pot lids with wooden spoons, grinning at the noise. 

MONTAGE – COLIN GROWING UP

- INT. FAMILY LIVING ROOM – NIGHT – 1969
Colin (age 7, slightly taller but still chubby, hair a bit longer, blue eyes) strums a toy guitar, mimicking Angus Young's duck walk. His mother, MRS. TURNER (40s, kind, brown hair), smiles.

- INT. SCHOOL AUDITORIUM – DAY – 1974
Colin (age 12) on stage, playing bass in a school talent show. His hair is shaggier, his shirt untucked. His friends cheer him from the audience.

- INT. GARAGE – NIGHT – 1978
Colin (age 16) with his first real band, THE WILD BUNCH. Colin sings into a mic, sweat on his brow, messy hair, wearing a faded Led Zeppelin tee. His bandmates are just as unruly. The music is loud and rough.

- INT. SMALL CLUB – NIGHT – 1985
Colin (age 23) on stage, now the frontman of IRON SHADOWS. The crowd is sparse, but Colin gives it his all, headbanging, hair sticking to his forehead. 

- INT. APARTMENT – NIGHT – 1993
Colin (age 31) sits alone, surrounded by old band flyers and demo tapes. He picks up a guitar, strums softly, and sighs, looking at a Nirvana poster on the wall. 

- INT. REHEARSAL SPACE – DAY – 1995
Colin (age 33) rallies a new group of musicians, encouraging them through laughter and missed notes. He’s still chubby, hair now shoulder-length, a bit more tired but energetic.

- EXT. MUSIC FESTIVAL STAGE – NIGHT – 2003
Colin (age 41) finally on a big stage with his band, THE TURNERS. Bright lights. Huge crowd. Colin, older, heavier, and happier than ever, rips into a guitar solo. 

CUT TO:

INT. BACKSTAGE – NIGHT
Colin, sweaty and exhausted, looks into a mirror. He straightens his messy hair and smiles at his reflection.

COLIN (V.O.):
It really is a long way to the top...

CUT TO:

EXT. MAIN STAGE – NIGHT
Colin stands under a dazzling sign made of lights: "It's a long way to the top if you want to rock n roll." He grins, raises his guitar, and launches into a final triumphant riff as the crowd roars.

FADE OUT.

END TITLE CARD: IT'S A LONG WAY TO THE TOP IF YOU WANT TO ROCK N ROLL.

storyboard.description: EXT. SUBURBAN BACKYARD – DAY – 1965: Colin, age 3, chubby, tousled blonde hair, blue eyes, sits in the grass banging pots with wooden spoons. Toys scattered around.
storyboard.dialogue: Colin giggles as he bangs the pots.

storyboard.description: INT. FAMILY LIVING ROOM – NIGHT – 1969: Colin, age 7, strums a toy guitar, imitating Angus Young. His mother watches from the couch, amused.
storyboard.dialogue: Colin: (singing) 'I'm on the highway to hell!'

storyboard.description: INT. COLIN'S BEDROOM – DAY – 1971: Colin, age 9, sticks rock band posters on the walls. He hums 'Stairway to Heaven.'
storyboard.dialogue: Colin: (softly) 'To be a rock and not to roll...'

storyboard.description: INT. SCHOOL AUDITORIUM – DAY – 1974: Colin, age 12, plays bass at a school talent show. Audience of kids laugh and clap.
storyboard.dialogue: Announcer: 'Give it up for Colin and the Wildcats!'

storyboard.description: BACKSTAGE – SCHOOL AUDITORIUM – 1974: Colin, age 12, high-fives friends, grinning with pride.
INT. GARAGE – NIGHT – 1978: Colin, age 16, with his first real band, THE WILD BUNCH. He sings into a mic, sweat on his brow.
INT. GARAGE – NIGHT – 1978: Colin, age 16, stands with his bandmates, laughing after rehearsal. Empty pizza boxes abound.
INT. COLIN'S BEDROOM – NIGHT – 1981: Colin, age 19, writes lyrics in a notebook, Metallica poster above his bed.
INT. SMALL CLUB – NIGHT – 1985: Colin, age 23, performing with IRON SHADOWS. Sparse crowd, neon lights.
INT. CLUB BATHROOM – NIGHT – 1985: Colin, age 23, splashes water on his face, looks in the mirror, determined.
INT. RECORDING STUDIO – DAY – 1988: Colin, age 26, singing into a microphone, headphones on, focused.
INT. RECORDING STUDIO – LOUNGE – DAY – 1988: Colin, age 26, laughs with bandmates, eating chips.
INT. APARTMENT – NIGHT – 1993: Colin, age 31, sits alone, surrounded by old band flyers and demo tapes, looking at a Nirvana poster.
INT. APARTMENT – NIGHT – 1993: Colin, age 31, picks up his guitar and slowly begins to play.
EXT. STREET – DAY – 1994: Colin, age 32, busking on the street, people passing by, some stop to listen.
INT. REHEARSAL SPACE – DAY – 1995: Colin, age 33, encouraging new bandmates through laughter and missed notes.
storyboard.dialogue: Colin: 'Let’s just have fun with it!'

storyboard.description: INT. REHEARSAL SPACE – DAY – 1995: Colin, age 33, hands out lyric sheets and tunes his guitar.
INT. BAR – NIGHT – 1997: Colin, age 35, plays with his band on a small stage, crowd claps modestly.
INT. BAR – NIGHT – 1997: Colin, age 35, sits at the bar, drinking soda, looking thoughtful.
INT. MUSIC STUDIO – DAY – 2000: Colin, age 38, records with new band, more professional setup.
INT. PRACTICE ROOM – EVENING – 2002: Colin, age 40, rehearses with THE TURNERS, excitement in the air.
EXT. MUSIC FESTIVAL STAGE – NIGHT – 2003: Colin, age 41, on stage with THE TURNERS, huge crowd, bright lights.
INT. BACKSTAGE – NIGHT – 2003: Colin, age 41, sweaty after the gig, straightens his hair in the mirror, grinning.
storyboard.dialogue: Colin (V.O.): 'It really is a long way to the top...'

storyboard.description: EXT. MAIN STAGE – NIGHT: Colin, age 41, stands under a dazzling sign made of lights: 'It's a long way to the top if you want to rock n roll.' He raises his guitar.
EXT. MAIN STAGE – NIGHT: Colin, age 41, performs a triumphant riff as the crowd roars beneath the glowing sign.
